summary: Honestly if game of thrones last scene ends with a hard cut to Bran after he’s done warging it out and looking into the future...
body:
Honestly if game of thrones last scene ends with a hard cut to Bran after he’s done warging it out and looking into the future (don’t think he can do that but hey it’s already a mess) and going “okay guys now I know what NOT to do”

I would be happy

summary: I seriously hope that bran will become bran.  He deserves better and I doubt that he is robot bran or tree bran in the books.
question: I seriously hope that bran will become bran.  He deserves better and I doubt that he is robot bran or tree bran in the books.
answer:
Same but at least we have the books. He is a wonderful character who will save the world

I know you like Bran but show one is literally robot who does nothing but stares and speaks with ominous voice. I’m disturbed that it’s him who ends in the position if power and Sansa, the only politician and leader who’s left

If show Bran is king then book Bran is king and book Bran hasn’t been butchered

summary: Jaime: I’m sorry for what I did to you. Bran: You weren’t sorry then. Jaime: I’m not that person anymore. Jamie, literally two...
body:
Jaime: I’m sorry for what I did to you.

Bran: You weren’t sorry then.

Jaime: I’m not that person anymore.

Jamie, literally two episodes later, going back to save Cersei and saying innocents dying doesn’t bother him:

R.I.P Jaime’s character development

summary: Bran to the Future
title: Bran to the Future
body:
Ok, so we’ve got one episode left. This season has been pretty garbage. Not a lot has made sense.

Which is why my last theory for the show is that everything that has happened in episodes 4 and 5 didn’t actually happen.

Hear me out.

My theory is that this is all taking place in Bran’s mind and that we’re still in the middle of the battle against the Night King. This is Bran looking into the future to see what happens should they defeat the Night King.

Which means things might still get worse before it’s revealed that this all hasn’t actually happened yet. They may even kill Tyrion. Possibly Jon, too. And then as Dany approaches whatever remains of the Iron Throne, Bran will appear, maybe sitting on the throne or standing in front of it. And then he’ll close his eyes there… and open his eyes in Winterfell as he did right before Theon’s death.

What happens after that with this new knowledge of how Dany will burn everything (as opposed to the Night King freezing everything)… I can’t say.

But I think this will be the final big shocker.

blog.name: onequeensansa
blog.title: (Eye-Catching Title)
blog.description: 23 year-old woman wasting time in this vortex of memes. The Witcher, Dragon Age, Game of Thrones, Assassins Creed and who knows what else.

summary: Why King Bran Isn’t the Worst Thing
body:
Why King Bran Isn’t the Worst Thing

Don’t get me wrong, I’ll be pissedTM if Bran becomes king - but, I’ve been thinking about it, and it’s not a horrible outcome. Here are a few major concerns and how I see it working out:

1) Bran won’t have an heir.

He has stated it himself - whether as a result of his injuries or simply lacking the desire, Bran won’t be spawning lil’ Bran Flakes. The concern is “who is going to take the throne after him? Won’t Westeros be plunged right back into chaos?!”

This is actually the perfect opportunity to set up a council of leaders, representing each of the seven kingdoms, and voting amongst them for king. It’s not democracy, but it’s a step in the right direction, electing people for their skills and viewpoints rather than blood.

2) Bran doesn’t want it (or anything)

He has also made it crystal clear that he doesn’t want to be Lord of Winterfell, so obviously why would he want to go all the way up the ladder to king? The show itself has said that the realm might do best under the leadership of one who doesn’t want power. In this case they were talking about Jon Snow, but the same logic applies. He’ll be practical and matter-of-fact, not letting his emotions get the best of him.

3) Bran’s the Three-Eyed Raven

Tying in with #2, Bran’s mind is… elsewhere. If he would stop being a dick and actually use his powers to help people (maybe, like, prevent Dany from bombing King’s Landing with her hot lizard), that could be beneficial. He could be his own scout, keeping a watchful eye on the realm. Of course, this also makes him sound like a spy drone, but in Westeros it’s whatever, they have bigger problems. They don’t even have dental.

TL;DR

Bran isn’t my top pick for the throne (or really anywhere near my top 5) but he wouldn’t suck. It sucks for those of us who are invested in other characters, but it could be good for Westeros.

summary: As gutted as I am about Jonsa not being endgame and Jon taking the black, the thing bothering me the most about the leaks is...
body:
As gutted as I am about Jonsa not being endgame and Jon taking the black, the thing bothering me the most about the leaks is BRAN STARK.

At this point Bran is an almost zombie. He doesn’t feel and is kind of weird. I would love to see his abilities used in a better manner, making him King is the absolute worst. I mean what would Bran even do as King? And what after Bran? More wars? Who will inherit the throne after him?

Are you telling me that after all this, nothing has actually changed? There is still an Iron Throne and a small council? It’s just weird.

summary: when bran said ‘the thing we do for love’ we thought he was just spooking jaime and he probably was but he saw the future and...
body: when bran said ‘the thing we do for love’ we thought he was just spooking jaime and he probably was but he saw the future and knew that jaime would try to save cersei and die in the attempt. this puts their conversation in a new prospective. jaime wasn’t the man he was when he pushed bran. the return to the city wasn’t jaime undoing everything he experienced and learnt, he was trying to protect cersei in a different manner, he sacrificed no one in the process (euron doesn’t count because he is euron), he went to the red keep immediately because that’s where he assumed dany would attack first and he calmed cersei down when it became clear they can’t escape. i mean seriously compare the two scenes

reblog.comment: when bran said ‘the thing we do for love’ we thought he was just spooking jaime and he probably was but he saw the future and knew that jaime would try to save cersei and die in the attempt. this puts their conversation in a new prospective. jaime wasn’t the man he was when he pushed bran. the return to the city wasn’t jaime undoing everything he experienced and learnt, he was trying to protect cersei in a different manner, he sacrificed no one in the process (euron doesn’t count because he is euron), he went to the red keep immediately because that’s where he assumed dany would attack first and he calmed cersei down when it became clear they can’t escape. i mean seriously compare the two scenes

trail.content: when bran said ‘the thing we do for love’ we thought he was just spooking jaime and he probably was but he saw the future and knew that jaime would try to save cersei and die in the attempt. this puts their conversation in a new prospective. jaime wasn’t the man he was when he pushed bran. the return to the city wasn’t jaime undoing everything he experienced and learnt, he was trying to protect cersei in a different manner, he sacrificed no one in the process (euron doesn’t count because he is euron), he went to the red keep immediately because that’s where he assumed dany would attack first and he calmed cersei down when it became clear they can’t escape. i mean seriously compare the two scenes

bit.ly/BookJonsa

Classical Authors: Vladimir Nabokov’s Lolita (see below), Victor Hugo and Jane Austen. Love Les Misérables-Book, Movie and musical.

True Crime: Johnny Gosch, Delphi Murders, Asha Degree, Jonbenet Ramsey, Madeleine McCann, Columbine. (Don’t glorify in the slightest). Serial Killers: Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer. Own the Johnny Gosch and Asha Degree subreddits.
